messages: 443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (15:41): danmorg: yes, oracle works "fine" under solaris express.. most releases at least... i installed on b47 last night ... EM didn't work properly but other than that the database works fine
3f80d62ed949f29a551f0f7d97ab8089 (15:43): hali, you use EM?)
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (15:44): hell: not very often... but emctl config failed in the automatic dbca process during the install... some java process hung
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (15:44): i left it for 20 minutes then killed it... perhaps it would have worked if i gave it more time... but i takes 5 minutes on a normal box
3f80d62ed949f29a551f0f7d97ab8089 (15:45): hm, for me, a don't like dbca :-)
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (15:45): it should work better under solaris express.... i tried under solaris express community release... to get the latest zfs stuff
3f80d62ed949f29a551f0f7d97ab8089 (15:45): what is solaris express?
3f80d62ed949f29a551f0f7d97ab8089 (15:45): open solaris?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (15:45): i usually use dbca for test and dev boxes.. to lazy
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (15:46): solaris express is sort of the solaris 10 beta
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (15:46): solaris express community release is opensolaris "solaris 11" beta
3f80d62ed949f29a551f0f7d97ab8089 (15:47): http://www.sun.com/software/solaris/solaris-express/
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (15:48): it's fun to try... all the latest zfs, brandz, zone features
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (15:49): and soon crossbow (the new improved self offloading tcp stack)
3f80d62ed949f29a551f0f7d97ab8089 (15:53): it always fun to try betas :-)
3f80d62ed949f29a551f0f7d97ab8089 (15:53): and i make fun everyday - apt-get upgrade :-D

07958aed77b67ca4bb39c55ea279045a (15:55): Hi, I would like to know if there is a x86_64 version of "Oracle Database 10g Express Edition"? I'm looking for it but until now I've just found x86 version. Thanks in advance.
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (15:57): JaVaSan_: unfortunatly not ... yet
07958aed77b67ca4bb39c55ea279045a (15:58): [hali]: but... Can I install x86 version on a x86_64 system without any problem?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (16:00): in a chroot then i presume?
07958aed77b67ca4bb39c55ea279045a (16:00): i'm not sure =/
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (16:01): i would not expect it to work
07958aed77b67ca4bb39c55ea279045a (16:01): I hope my system take care of it..
07958aed77b67ca4bb39c55ea279045a (16:01): fedora core 5
3f80d62ed949f29a551f0f7d97ab8089 (16:01): and, i think, x64 for XE does not needed, it limited to 1GB of memory....
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (16:02): nothing 32-bit usually work on a 64-bit linux system
3f80d62ed949f29a551f0f7d97ab8089 (16:02): i think, that 32 bits are enough for 1gb :-)
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (16:02): without chrooting and other version of all libraries etc
07958aed77b67ca4bb39c55ea279045a (16:03): well.. I'm trying to get some advice in fedora channel.
3f80d62ed949f29a551f0f7d97ab8089 (16:04): for solaris there are no problem, as i understand)
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (16:11): solaris does it right from the start :)
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (16:11): so does freebsd
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (16:11): linux is sort of broken in that area
07958aed77b67ca4bb39c55ea279045a (16:12): [hali]: what OS do you use?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (16:12): JaVaSan_: most of them :)

443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (16:13): centos linux .. at least for testing and dev
07958aed77b67ca4bb39c55ea279045a (16:13): [hali]: is it really good for testing and dev?

443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (16:15): fc5 runs xe just fine
